awd_titl_txt: U.S.-Brazil Cooperative Research:  Nutrient Uptake by       Aquatic Macrophytes to Reduce Environmental Degradation
awd_abstract_narration: 9722459  Biesboer    This U.S.-Brazil award will support a research collaboration  between Dr. David D. Biesboer of the University of Minnesota  and Dr. Francisco Estevez of Federal University of Rio de  Janeiro in Brazil on the study of sustainable development  and nitrogen cycling in of Lagoa Imboacica, Rio de Janeiro  State, Brazil.    This research project will involve the study of basic  aspects of nitrogen cycling and nutrient uptake by aquatic  macrophytes in the tropical lagoons of Rio de Janeiro in  Brazil.  The goal is to determine the effectiveness of five  floating and emergent aquatic plant species to remove excess  nutrients and improve the quality of residential wastewater  flowing into the tropical lagoon, Lagoa Imboacica.  After  the successful completion of this study, the PIs will use  the resultant information in the creation of a model aquatic  plant wastewater treatment facility that will reduce the  environmental degradation of this lagoon.  The information  gathered from this project will serve to increase our  understanding of nitrogen cycling in tropical lagoons and  provide experience in artificial wetland design.    ***
